parameters.toolDescription: Sends a message to the specific 'benai-content' Slack channel. Use for general updates or notifications intended for this channel only. Requires the 'Message_Text'.
Retrieves a specific record by its ID. Use when you know the exact record ID and need complete details about a single contact, company, deal, or task.
Searches for records matching specific criteria using Airtable formulas. Use for finding contacts by name, email, status, or priority. Example: {Status} = 'Lead' AND {Priority} = 'High'
Returns the structure of the Airtable base, including all tables, fields, and field types. Use when you need to understand the database structure or verify field names before creating records.

Creates a new event on the primary Google Calendar. Requires 'Start' time, 'End' time. Optionally accepts 'Attendees' (email list) and 'Summary' (Meeting Title) and 'Description'.

Expects 'Start' and 'End' times as ISO 8601 strings with timezone offsets (e.g., YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM).
Deletes a specific event from the Google Calendar. Requires the unique 'Event_ID' of the event to delete.
Retrieves details for a specific event from the Google Calendar. Requires the unique 'Event_ID'.
Updates an existing event on the Google Calendar. Requires the 'Event_ID' of the event to update, along with the new field values (e.g., 'Description', 'Location', times, attendees).
Checks the free/busy status for the primary Google Calendar within a given time window. Requires 'Start_Time' and 'End_Time' to define the query range.

Retrieves a list of events from the primary Google Calendar occurring within a specified time window. Requires 'Start_Time' (After) and 'End_Time' (Before). Can optionally 'Return_All' events in the range.
Retrieve the profile of a user from a link or a slug that's given to you.

values.name: {profileID}
values.description:
=The providerâ€™s public id of the requested user, it should be extracted from the profile url:
If the profile provided is: https://www.linkedin.com/in/benvansprundel/
the profileID is: benvansprundel

parameters.toolDescription: Send an invitation to add someone to your contacts, you'll have to use the provider_id provided to you to send the request, also you'll have to draft a really amazing message from the data you have about the user and the message should be under 300 characters.
Publish a post over linkedin, the post you create should be viral worthy targeting higher Executives, the content should address the pain-point.

=Perform LinkedIn using search filters.IMPORTANT: For searching linkedin you ALWAYS have to use account_id: O-fsjbp9TXm63aLf94irWQ.

Filter 1: Keywords [The keywords/name/company name to start the search from to be used inside the linkedin search]

Filter 2: Category [Category can be posts, people or companies if you want to search for posts use posts, for people keep the category people, similarly when you're searching for companies keep it companies]

Along with the account_id as mandatory. You'll be in responsible to list all the chats based on the filters.
Start a new conversation with one or more attendee.
Retrieve the details of a chat.

values.name: {chat_id}
values.description: The Unipile or provider ID of the chat.

parameters.toolDescription: Returns a list of messages related to the given chat. Some parameters are available to filter the results.

values.name: {chat_id}
values.description: The Unipile or provider ID of the chat.

values.name: {before}
values.description: A filter to target items created before the datetime (exclusive). Must be an ISO 8601 UTC datetime (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ).

values.name: {after}
values.description: A filter to target items created after the datetime (exclusive). Must be an ISO 8601 UTC datetime (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ).

values.name: {limit}
values.description: A limit for the number of items returned in the response. The value can be set between 1 and 250.

parameters.toolDescription: =Send a message to the given chat, you will have a personality for the text message.

values.name: {chat_id}
values.description: The id of the chat where to send the message.

values.name: {account_id}
values.description: An account_id can be specified to prevent the user from sending messages in chats not belonging to the account, this is distinct to each of the types of Account primarily Linkedin & Whatsapp

parameters.toolDescription:
=Returns a list of chats for the specific platform there are 2 platforms LINKEDIN & WHATSAPP, each of these have 2 distinct account IDs. For listing chats from linkedin you have to use account ID: O-fsjbp9TXm63aLf94irWQ. And for listing chats from Whatsapp you have to use account ID: zAPMfeHRS2aEoxU--XdA0Q. You'll be in responsible to list all the chats based on the filters.

Filter 1: unread [boolean either true or false],

Filter 2: before [string, A filter to target items created before the datetime (exclusive). Must be an ISO 8601 UTC datetime (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ).]

Filter 3: after [A filter to target items created after the datetime (exclusive). Must be an ISO 8601 UTC datetime (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ).]

Filter 4: account_type [WHATSAPP/LINKEDIN] each will have their distinct account_id

Filter 5: account_id [A filter to target items related to a certain account. Can be a comma-separated list of ids.] string
=Returns a list of messaging attendees.
Sends a direct message (DM) to a specified Slack user. Requires the Slack 'User' ID or name and the 'Message_Text'.
Retrieves a list of all users in the Slack workspace. Useful for finding user IDs needed for sending Direct Messages (DMs). Can optionally 'Return_All' users.
Searches for past messages within Slack based on a text 'Search_Query'. Useful for finding information in previous conversations. Can optionally 'Return_All' matching messages.
Creates a draft email in the connected Gmail account. It does NOT send the email, only saves it as a draft. Requires 'Subject' and 'Message' body
parameters.subject: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('Subject', ``, 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription: Replies to a specific existing email thread in Gmail. Requires the 'Message_ID' of the thread to reply to, and the 'Message' body for the reply

Retrieves emails from the connected Gmail account. Allows filtering to find specific emails based on various criteria. Available optional filters:
*   `Search` (string): General search query matching keywords in subject, body, or sender (uses Gmail's standard search syntax like 'from:sender@example.com subject:urgent').
*   `Sender` (string): Filter for emails specifically FROM this email address.
*   `Received_After` (string): Only retrieve emails received AFTER this date or date/time (e.g., '2024-04-10', '2024-04-10T10:00:00Z').
*   `Received_Before` (string): Only retrieve emails received BEFORE this date or date/time (e.g., '2024-04-11', '2024-04-10T18:30:00Z').
Specify `Return_All` (boolean) as true to fetch all matching emails, otherwise a default limit applies. If no filters are provided, it retrieves recent emails.
Adds one or more specified Gmail labels to a specific email message. Requires the 'Message_ID' of the email and the 'Label_Names_or_IDs' to add.
Sends a new email using the connected Gmail account. Requires the recipient ('To'), 'Subject', and 'Message' body.
parameters.subject: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('Subject', ``, 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Creates **new** records in the specified Airtable CRM. 

Required parameters:
- `baseId`: The Airtable base ID (e.g., "appnVclCBAu8JBs3W")
- `tableId`: The table ID for the table you want to add to
- `fields`: An object containing field names and their values for the new record

Updates **existing** records in the specified Airtable CRM. 

Required parameters:
- `baseId`: The Airtable base ID (e.g., "appnVclCBAu8JBs3W")
- `tableId`: The table ID for the table you want to update
- `records`: An array containing objects with:
  - `id`: The unique record ID to update
  - `fields`: An object containing field names and their new value

parameters.name: supabase
parameters.description: =Retrieve information from the supabase, using phrases or keywords of the given query, and then distill it and output it as detailed as possible, your inputs are short and targeted whereas your outputas are Detailed. the input should be phrases.

nodes.name: Answer questions with a vector store

parameters.name: Linkedin_post_generator
parameters.description:
Generate an optimized linkedin post based on an idea or transcript. if it is based on a transcript use the ENTIRE transcript as an input, if it is an idea use the ENTIRE idea as your input. ONLY pass in the idea or the transcript, nothing else, no instructions, no summaries. 

It is vital to my career your output is COMPLETE, no summaries allowed in your output, ONLY the full output of the tool call.

parameters.name: Image_Generator
parameters.description:
Generate an image for the linkedin post, use a very clear and detailed prompt when  using this tool to generate an image. Avoid saying things like "generate an image", you should ONLY input the prompt to generate the image. 

Make sure to get all 3 the entire png urls back.

parameters.description: Call this tool to scrape the content of a site.

values.description: The query used for the search
